title: Mutual Reinforcement of LLM Dialogue Synthesis and Summarization Capabilities for Few-Shot Dialogue Summarization
author: Yen-Ju Lu (Johns Hopkins University), Ting-Yao Hu (Apple), Hema Swetha Koppula, Hadi Pouransari, Jen-Hao Rick Chang, Yin Xia, Xiang Kong, Qi Zhu, Simon Wang, Oncel Tuzel, Raviteja Vemulapalli, ..., the last author
relevance_why: The paper introduces a framework that mutually reinforces dialogue synthesis and summarization, which can be beneficial for advancements in audio processing tasks where conversation synthesis or summarization is relevant.
background: Few-shot dialogue summarization aims to generate concise summaries of conversations with limited annotated data from target domains.
contribution: This paper introduces the Mutual Reinforcing Data Synthesis (MRDS) method to enhance dialogue synthesis and summarization, achieving improved performance metrics in summarization tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often relied on external data or models for dialogue summarization, which could limit applicability in few-shot scenarios.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon these limitations by integrating synthesis and summarization in a mutually beneficial training loop without needing external datasets.

key_innovation: The MRDS framework utilizes a cyclical enhancement strategy where the dialogue synthesis improves summarization and vice versa, effectively generating high-quality synthetic data.
real_world_impact: The proposed method enhances dialogue summarization capabilities, which can improve customer service interactions, educational tools, and any context where effective dialogue summarization is critical.
limitations: The authors acknowledge that the method requires additional computation cost during the synthesis phase and assumes internal knowledge of the model is useful, which might not be true for highly specialized domains.

new_terms.Mutual Reinforcing Data Synthesis (MRDS): **Mutual Reinforcing Data Synthesis (MRDS)** is a novel framework for enhancing dialogue synthesis and summarization by leveraging the strengths of each capability in a feedback loop.
